front.p: 1883 July 31: to Hill Rex Nan Kivell collection, NK4168: Australian National Library Ms 4246. p118.

body.p:
H. Hill, Esq
Inspr. of Schools

Your letter to me of yesterday I only got on my return home last night: I lose no time in replying;—prefacing what I am about to write, with a heartfelt regret at my having unintentionally been the means of causing you so much extra writing in this matter.—
Since you particularly wish it, I will write my name down for insertion in those volumes: perhaps, better under what you have given as an example,—say after “1883.”—
I would also suggest for your consideration, whether it would not be preferable for you to write “Inspector of Schools” after your own name, instead of “Secretary”?

Were I going to town today I would call in at your office,—but as I have to attend a meeting of our Society tomorrow (3 p.m.) I defer my visit till then. If fine, and I have spare time, I will with pleasure look in at about 2.30 p.m.—
